newsitem.title: USA: Gloria Jean's says will raise retail coffee prices.
newsitem.headline: Gloria Jean's says will raise retail coffee prices.

text.p: Gloria Jean's Gourmet Coffees, the second-largest specialty coffee retailer in the U.S., said Tuesday it will raise the price of brewed coffee by 10 cents per cup to reflect higher world green coffee prices.

The increase, which takes effect July 6, will raise the price of an eight-ounce cup of coffee to $1.05 and 12-ounce cup to $1.25. The price of a 16-ounce cup of coffee will not change, the company said in a statement.
The Castroville, Calif., company said the price hike at its 260 franchise and corporate-owned stores will be iits first since world coffee prices began to skyrocket.

"Most retailers have already raised prices once, or in some cases twice," Gloria Jean's president Alton McEwen said in the statement. "Gloria Jean's had locked in the price it pays for most of its coffees prior to world coffee prices increasing, and we let our customers benefit from this favorable position.
"However, with world prices continuing to be much higher than a year ago, Gloria Jean's is now incurring higher prices for some of the very high quality coffee that we sell," he added.
Suggested retail prices will rise an average of $1.00 per lb to $9.99 for blends and varietal coffee beans and $10.99 for flavored coffees, the company said.

Although arabica coffee prices traded on New York's Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange have fallen nearly 40 percent since peaking at 20-year highs in May, McEwen said the coffee market, which is facing a shortage of premium coffees used in the specilaty sector, remained volatile and prices were still steep.

"Current prices are double what they were in December, but in late May they were more than triple," he said. "The reduction from the May high may get reported as coffee prices coming down, although they remain very high relative to the long-term average."
Gloria Jean's is a subsidiary of Second Cup of Toronto, a leading specialty coffee retailer in Canada.
